title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4695-4701: Searching for Answers at Monte Grande
summary: Written by William Farrand, Senior Research Scientist, Space Science Institute Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 24, 2025 Curiosity has successfully drilled its 44th hole on Mars, which is a major milestone in our investigation of the enigmatic “boxwork unit,” a region of resistant ridges surrounding pits or “hollows” of less-resistant rock. The drilling took place […]

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4689-4694: Drill in the Boxwork Unit is GO!
summary: Written by Catherine O’Connell-Cooper, APXS Payload Uplink/Downlink Lead, University of New Brunswick Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 17, 2025 Curiosity has been investigating the “boxwork unit” for several months now. Readers might remember we drilled at the edge of the boxwork at “Altadena,” back in June. Since then, we have driven just under a kilometer […]

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4682-4688: Seven Mars Years
summary: Written by Diana Hayes, Graduate Student at York University, Toronto Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 10, 2025 This week was one of seasonal changes and milestones for the mission. title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4675-4681: Deciding Where to Dig Into the Boxworks
summary: Written by Michelle Minitti, MAHLI Deputy Principal Investigator at Framework Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 3, 2025 Before Curiosity landed 13 years ago, the science team eyed all the geologic wonders scattered across the flanks of Mount Sharp and looked forward to the day when we could put the rover to work on them. title: Blue Origin launches twin Mars probes for NASA as New Glenn makes first landing
summary: Blue Origin launched its second heavy-lift New Glenn rocket Thursday, putting two small NASA satellites onto a long, looping course to Mars to learn more about how the sun has slowly blown away the red planet's once thick atmosphere.

title: New Glenn launches NASA’s ESCAPADE Mars mission, lands booster
summary:
Blue Origin successfully launched a NASA Mars mission on the second flight of its New Glenn booster Nov. 13, landing the vehicle’s first stage in the process.
The post New Glenn launches NASA’s ESCAPADE Mars mission, lands booster appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: IonQ expands into space networking with acquisition of Skyloom
summary:
Skyloom Global is a Colorado-based provider of space-based optical communications terminals

title: A Robotic Helping Hand
summary: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim took this photo on July 23, 2025, as the International Space Station orbited 259 miles above a cloudy Pacific Ocean southwest of Mexico.
